page.title: 02SHEEP HURDLE MAKING
page.content: In Colly Grove Copse, there is an old man who makes sheep hurdles. In Colly Grove Copse most of the trees are hazel so it is ideal for making sheep hurdles. It is good because hazel is supple. The man has been doing it for a long time. Every two years the hazel hurdles have to be replaced. The man has made himself a little log cabin. The hurdler works near the road so that anyone can see him if they pass by Colly Grove Copse. The man has to stay in the log cabin and make hurdles for about six to seven months a year because Longwood Estate own about four thousand sheep that are penned with hazel hurdles. The man has used a lot of trees. Colly Grove Copse is twelve hectares in area. It was larger, but some of the trees were cut down to make more farm land.
